speaker: Viral image
vclaim: There were no American flags in the first democratic presidential debate.
date: stated on June 27, 2019 in a post on Facebook:
title: The stage of democratic debate has been decorated by stars and lines and a lot of red, white and blue.
text: In the race to the White House, who's the most patriotic candidate? It's not Democrats, the Facebook article recently suggests. "No American flag in the democratic debate," read the text along with the picture of the presidential candidates who participated in the first two nights of discussions hosted by NBC. The photo was posted on Facebook on June 27, before the second discussion, and some commentators who took the opportunity to condemn the values of the Democratic Party were outraged. This article, in which more than 4,300 people participated in less than 24 hours, was referred to as part of Facebook efforts to combat false news and misleading information in its broadcast. ∙ (Read more about our partnership with Facebook.) An NBC News spokesman did not respond immediately to the e-mail of Politi Fact, which she asked about the allegation. However, given the photos of the debate, we found more than the digital picture of the White House appearing behind the candidates on Facebook. Facebook was published on January 11, 2021 in Facebook, Nancy Belusi, who was no longer the Speaker of the House of Representatives by Samantha Butterman (January 12, 2021). This picture shows Getty, for example, the NBC News logo with red and white lines of science, and a graph behind the candidates is like a flag torn in the wind. Red, white, blue, stars and lines dominate the stage. You can see more of these pictures here and here. In addition, we have found photographs of a number of candidates who exercise American flag pins, including the Republic of Tim Ryan, the Republic of Tulsey Shepherd, and former Congressman Maryland John Delaney, Mayor of New York City Bill Deblacio, who do not have physical flags in the photographs. But looking for pictures of the 2016 Presidential Presidential discussions, it seems that similar groups have used -- a lot of stars, lines and American paintings. We looked through Jetty's photo pages from the first discussion, and we didn't see anything with a natural American flag made of cloth. But the theater contained a digital collection that featured pictures of the flag - including a photo posted on the photo of the White House on Facebook - and many candidates were wearing flag pins on their buttons. We value this allegation wrong.
